business.headline: India-US Bilateral Trade Agreement: Final Phase Negotiations Aim For ConclusionUnion Minister Piyush Goyal will lead a team to the United States for trade talks. India and the US are working to finalize the Bilateral Trade Agreement (BTA) by early July. The US President has proposed a trade agreement with India that would have no tariffs on a wide range of American products. The US President stated, 'India is one of the highest tariff nations in the world. It's very hard to sell into India.'

Adani drops Chinese lounge partner DragonPass: What it means for Indian flyersThe move, triggered by rising national security concerns, has ended DragonPass's access to Adani-managed airport lounges across the country.

Why the middle class is chasing expensive brands, explains market expertA market expert noted that nearly 75% of luxury spending today comes from the middle class, not due to rising incomes, but because of social media, marketing tricks, and peer pressure that fuel the urge to appear successful.

Indian traders' body boycotts Turkey and Azerbaijan over support for PakistanThe move comes after both Turkey and Azerbaijan openly showed support for Pakistan, at a time when India is facing sensitive national security challenges.

India-US trade deal: First phase likely to be ready by July 1, say sourcesIndia and the United States are in negotiations for a trade deal, with sources indicating that phase one could be ready by July 1st.

India to grow at 6.3%, ahead of China, US, and European Union: UN reportAccording to the UN's mid-year update of the World Economic Situation and Prospects (WESP), India's growth is being fuelled by strong household spending and solid government investments.

Sensex slips 200 points, Nifty holds ground above 25,000; defence stocks surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 200.15 points to close at 82,330.59, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 42.30 points to end at 25,019.80.

2 IPOs to open next week: Check Belrise Industries, Borana Weaves detailsWhile Belrise Industries will open for bidding on May 21, investors can bid for the IPO of Borana Weaves starting May 20, 2025.

ITR filing 2025: Is July 31 your tax deadline? Find outFiling your return on time helps avoid penalties and delays in refunds. It also keeps your financial records in order. So, if your deadline is July 31, skip the last-minute rush and file in advance.

ITR filing 2025: Is digital Form 16 a game-changer for salaried taxpayers?Digital Form 16 is an electronic version of the traditional Form 16. It's generated directly from the TRACES portal, which is managed by the Income Tax Department. This means all your salary details, TDS, and tax-saving deductions are recorded accurately and match what the government sees.

Government clears 187 startups for tax relief. Here's what it meansTo qualify, the start-up must be recognised by the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT). It should be a private limited company or a limited liability partnership and its turnover should not cross Rs 100 crore in any year since incorporation.

What Pakistan can and can't do with IMF loanThe International Monetary Fund (IMF) has approved a fresh loan package for Pakistan, agreeing to release USD 1 billion under its Extended Fund Facility (EFF).

entertainment.headline: How Lady Superstar Nayanthara rose above controversies and ruled Tamil cinemaFrom her legal battle with Dhanush to facing online trolls after the birth of her twin boys, Nayanthara has navigated a range of controversies throughout her career. Here is an overview of some of these challenges and how the Lady Superstar managed them—all while steadily rising to fame.

Nayanthara joins Chiranjeevi's 157th film with Anil Ravipudi, announcement video outIt's official! Nayanthara has been roped in for megastar Chiranjeevi's next film, tentatively titled 'Mega157'. Set for a Sankranthi 2026 release, it is directed by Anil Ravipudi.

Guns N' Roses Mumbai performance: The rock revival we've all been waiting forGuns N' Roses is set to electrify Mumbai with their iconic rock energy on May 17 at the Mahalaxmi Race Course. This concert promises to be a legendary celebration of timeless anthems and unforgettable performances.

Kristen Stewart's directorial debut impresses Cannes with four-minute ovationKristen Stewart made her directorial debut with 'The Chronology of Water'. The film received appreciation at the ongoing Cannes Film Festival.

Beyond beauty, beneath pain: Why filmmakers keep returning to a wounded Kashmir?What is it about Kashmir that keeps attracting cinema? Why do filmmakers keep going back to the Valley despite its turbulent past? It certainly can't be all about beauty. It is more. On Cinematic Saturday, we spoke to the actors and directors who have shot in Kashmir, to understand why Kashmir is for cinema.

Joaquin Phoenix in tears as Eddington gets five-minute standing ovation at Cannes'Eddington', starring Joaquin Phoenix, Emma Stone, Pedro Pascal and Austin Butler, received thunderous applause at the 78th Cannes Film Festival. In clips that were shared online, Phoenix is seen visibly moved by the response.

Black, White and Gray creator says show is about us, not about its charactersSony LIV's crime thriller 'Black White and Gray - Love Kills' broke new ground with its unique mockumentary style, offering a compelling narrative that explores the complexities of human nature. The show challenged viewers to rethink their perceptions of truth and bias, delivering a culturally rooted story that resonates deeply with Indian audiences.

Mission Impossible 8 review: Tom Cruise vs AI battle, guess who wins?Released-Sat May 17, 2025Tom Cruise once again dazzles with breathtaking stunts and nostalgia in 'Mission Impossible: The Final Reckoning', proving his unmatched dedication to action cinema. Despite some narrative flaws, the film stands out for its thrilling sequences and Cruise's charisma, even at 62.

It's Okay to Not be Okay to Doctor Slump: Evolution of mental health portrayalK-dramas have evolved significantly in portraying mental health, moving from stigma and stereotypes to nuanced and empathetic storytelling. These dramas now highlight real struggles like trauma, anxiety, and burnout, encouraging open conversations about mental well-being.

Kunal Kohli says Saif did Hum Tum after 3 top stars rejected the classicDirector Kunal Kohli revealed that 'Hum Tum' was originally offered to Hrithik Roshan, Aamir Khan, and Vivek Oberoi before Saif Ali Khan landed the role. The iconic romantic comedy re-released in theatres on May 16.

Parul Gulati reacts to claims that Indian actors 'pay' to be at CannesActor Parul Gulati reacted to Cannes banning 'naked' dressing as she is set to make her debut at the prestigious festival. The actor stated that she did not want to feel pressured by it.
Ironheart trailer: Riri Williams takes forward Tony Stark's Iron Man legacyRiri Williams, played by Dominique Thorne, takes forward Iron Man's legacy in the MCU's 'Ironheart' as a genius inventor.

Rani Mukerji as Suhana Khan's mother in Shah Rukh Khan-Deepika's King: ReportRani Mukerji is set to reunite with Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone in Siddharth Anand's upcoming action-thriller 'King', playing a pivotal cameo role. The film begins shooting this month and is slated for a late 2026 release.

Justin Bieber's team addresses rumours of being Sean Diddy's assault victimJustin Bieber's team recently addressed rumours about being sexually assaulted by Sean 'Diddy' Combs.  They mentioned how 'nothing untoward' happened between them.

Pawan Kalyan's Hari Hara Veera Mallu gets release date after multiple delaysAfter several delays, Pawan Kalyan's long-anticipated historical action film, 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu: Part 1 – Sword vs Spirit', is finally gearing up for release on June 12.

Singer Amaal Mallik's family is 'closer, happier' after his decision to break tiesMusic composer Amaal Mallik recently opened up about his battle with depression and the emotional post where he distanced himself from his family. The singer shared that while it initially hurt, his distance has brought his family closer together.

Anaganaga review: A decent film about life beyond marksReleased-Fri May 16, 2025Anaganaga movie review: This Telugu drama film, starring Sumanth in the lead, keeps a mirror in front of the present education system, and hits the right emotional chords to shine light on the problem and the solution.

Vikrant Massey in Karan Johar's Dostana 2 after Kartik Aaryan's exit: ReportVikrant Massey is rumoured to be replacing Kartik Aaryan in Karan Johar's much-delayed Dostana 2, which is expected to begin shooting in January 2026. The film will also star Lakshya and introduce a fresh female lead.

BTS' Jin shares heartbreak anthem Don't Say You Love Me from album EchoBTS's Jin dropped the new music video for the title track, 'Don't Say You Love Me', featuring actor Shin Se-kyung. The song is a part of his album, 'Echo'.

general news.headline: Shashi Tharoor among 7 MPs named for vital role in Operation Sindoor outreachSenior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor will lead one of the seven all-party delegations of MPs tasked with briefing key foreign governments on the recent India-Pakistan conflict.

Rift out in open? Centre snubs Congress picks, names Shashi Tharoor for key roleShashi Tharoor was among the seven MPs named by the Centre to lead an all-party delegation to expose Pakistan-sponsored terrorism. However, Tharoor's name was not recommended by the Congress.

Trump's own 'Big Boss'? US plans reality show for immigrants to get citizenshipThe US Homeland Security is considering a TV show where immigrants will be made to go through a series of challenges to compete for US citizenship.

Why do filmmakers keep going back to the Valley despite its turbulent past? It certainly can't be all about beauty. It is more. On Cinematic Saturday, we spoke to the actors and directors who have shot in Kashmir, to understand why Kashmir is for cinema.

Despite some narrative flaws, the film stands out for its thrilling sequences and Cruise's charisma, even at 62.
ED raids Gujarat Samachar's Mumbai premises day after action against co-ownerRaids at Gujarat Samachar's Mumbai premises day after ED action against one of its owners

Caught on camera: Bengaluru techie killed in hit-and-run over cigarette disputeA man in a Hyundai Creta followed the software engineer duo and deliberately rammed his vehicle into their motorcycle after they allegedly refused to give him a cigarette. One was killed, and his friend remains in critical condition.

Beneath the blue: India's Samudrayaan dives into the unknownThe vast open seas harbour some of the most pristine, untouched environments and precious resources that remain hidden from the clutches of man.

Shashi Tharoor in India's global outreach mission: Why it makes senseCongress leader Shashi Tharoor has been picked for India's Operation Sindoor global outreach mission and so has AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi. A few days prior, India Today commentator Kamlesh Kishore Singh had mooted the very same idea, highlighting the Kerala MP's diplomatic and linguistic prowess that can cripple Pakistan's post-operation illusion. Tharoor's gravitas and Owaisi's firepower could prove to be India's best shot at reclaiming the global narrative, he had argued. We are re-offering the full article in the context of the latest development.
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

Rescuers say 100 killed in Israel's fresh Gaza offensive 'Gideon Chariots'Israel launched a new offensive in Gaza, dubbed Operation Gideon Chariots, with reports of 100 likely killed. The strikes come amid rising international pressure over the humanitarian crisis.

Security forces launch search ops in J&K after intel on presence of terroristsSecurity forces have launched search operations in multiple Jammu and Kashmir districts after the input of the movement of three suspected terrorists in Samba.

Suzuki Access Ride Connect TFT Edition launched at Rs 1,01,900Suzuki has launched the new Access Ride Connect TFT Edition, featuring a Bluetooth-enabled TFT display, refreshed colour options, and the same 125cc OBD2-compliant engine.

Men from ISIS sleeper module arrested in Mumbai after being 2 years on the runThe National Investigation Agency arrested two ISIS Pune sleeper cell absconders at Mumbai Airport after over two years on the run. They were involved in fabricating and testing IEDs to carry out terrorist acts in Maharashtra.

Shashi Tharoor may lead India's Op Sindoor outreach to US, Owaisi also namedCongress leader Shashi Tharoor is expected to lead an all-party delegation to the US to brief the Trump administration on India's military tensions with Pakistan and its regional security position.

Himachal Pradesh Board declares Class 12 result. Here's how to check scoresHPBOSE 12th Result 2025: Here's how to check scoresThe Himachal Pradesh Board of School Education (HPBOSE) has declared the Class 12 Result 2025 today. Students can now access their scores for all streams on the official website, hpbose.org.

Joaquin Phoenix in tears as Eddington gets five-minute standing ovation at Cannes'Eddington', starring Joaquin Phoenix, Emma Stone, Pedro Pascal and Austin Butler, received thunderous applause at the 78th Cannes Film Festival. In clips that were shared online, Phoenix is seen visibly moved by the response.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Asim Munir woke me up at 2.30 am: Pak PM confirms India strikes on key airbasesIndia conducted precision strikes on Pakistani military sites, including Nur Khan Air Base, on May 10 as part of Operation Sindoor. The strikes were in retaliation to the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack, in which 26 people were killed.

George and Amal Clooney say they've never fought. Marriage goals, or not?Is it really possible to be in a long-term relationship and never fight? And more importantly, should we even be aiming for that?
Uber driver pulled gun on passengers after row over directions. Video goes viralMiami-based rapper Krissy Celess shared a video of herself being threatened at gunpoint by an Uber driver.

Relief, then fire: Neeraj Chopra's 90m mark breakthrough lights a fresh fuseAfter years of near misses, Neeraj Chopra finally broke the elusive 90-metre barrier in the Doha Diamond League on Friday, marking a historic milestone. Yet, with fierce rivals rising, this breakthrough signals just the beginning of a new, fiercer battle ahead.

Wait, did Parul Gulati wear a braided-hair dress to Cannes red carpet?In a conceptual tribute to her wig and hair extension brand Nish Hair, Parul Gulati wore a braided-hair dress for her red debut at the Cannes Film Festival.

Hyundai to launch next-gen Venue, Ioniq 5 facelift in 2025; 26 cars planned by 2030Hyundai Motor India revealed an ambitious plan to launch 26 new models by 2030, starting with the next-gen Venue and Ioniq 5 facelift, aiming to strengthen its market presence.

sports.headline: RCB vs KKR: Live weather updates from Chinnaswamy StadiumRCB vs KKR, IPL 2025, Bengaluru weather live updates: As cricket fans gear up for the resumption of IPL, the wait has high chances of getting delayed with persistent rainfall in Bengaluru, that has sparked serious concerns over whether the highly anticipated fixture will go ahead as planned — or at least, without interruption.

Sinner vs Alcaraz: All you need to know about Italian Open 2025 finalItalian Open 2025: Jannik Sinner beat Tommy Paul on Saturday to set up a clash with four-time Grand Slam champion Carlos Alcaraz on Sunday, May 18.

Ruben Amorim says United's Chelsea loss will help him pick Europa Final XIRuben Amorim drew positives from Manchester United's Premier League loss to Chelsea, revealing that the performance helped him shape ideas for the starting XI in their high-stakes Europa League final against Tottenham Hotspur.
Praggnanandhaa wins Superbet Classic after a tough tiebreakR Praggnanandhaa clinched his maiden title on the Grand Chess Tour by outplaying France's Maxime Vachier-Lagrave in the Superbet Classic.

UAE vs Bangladesh T20I series: Squads, schedule and all you knowLitton Das' Bangladesh and Muhammad Waseem's United Arab Emirates (UAE) will be up against each other in a two-match T20I series at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium.

Suryakumar Yadav pens heartfelt tribute to Rohit Sharma on Wankhede honourSuryakumar Yadav shared a heartfelt tribute to ODI skipper Rohit Sharma after the Wankhede Stadium named a stand in his honour, celebrating the Mumbai legend's legacy and achievements in the presence of dignitaries and family.

IPL 2025 playoffs scenarios explained: What each team needs to do to qualifyThe race for the playoffs is heating up as IPL 2025 resumes following a one-week break due to India-Pakistan tensions. With 13 league games remaining, seven of the 10 teams remain mathematically in contention for a playoff spot. Former champions Chennai Super Kings, Rajasthan Royals, and Sunrisers Hyderabad have been eliminated from the race.

Shubman, Shreyas or Pant? Sunil Gavaskar picks his next India captainFormer batter Sunil Gavaskar reckoned that Shubman Gill is the most apt choice as the Indian Test captain after Rohit Sharma bid goodbye to the purest format earlier this month.

Yet, with fierce rivals rising, this breakthrough signals just the beginning of a new, fiercer battle ahead.

Roston Chase replaces Kraigg Brathwaite as new West Indies Test captainRoston Chase has been named the new West Indies Test captain, stepping into the role after Kraigg Brathwaite's resignation, as the team prepares to host Australia in their opening World Test Championship series.

Spectacular feat, India is proud: PM praises Neeraj Chopra after 90.23 metres throwPrime Minister Narendra Modi praised Neeraj Chopra's historic 90.23m throw at the Doha Diamond League, celebrating his first-ever 90-meter milestone and applauding his dedication to this historic feat.

With 13 league games remaining, seven of the 10 teams remain mathematically in contention for a playoff spot. Former champions Chennai Super Kings, Rajasthan Royals, and Sunrisers Hyderabad have been eliminated from the race.

Yet, with fierce rivals rising, this breakthrough signals just the beginning of a new, fiercer battle ahead.

Roston Chase replaces Kraigg Brathwaite as new West Indies Test captainRoston Chase has been named the new West Indies Test captain, stepping into the role after Kraigg Brathwaite's resignation, as the team prepares to host Australia in their opening World Test Championship series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
